author: ajsutton
content: It does seem like users should expect to do a client update between genesis becoming known and the actual start of the chain. It's far too easy for bootnodes and things like that to not actually work like we expected.

author: ajsutton
content: It makes me wonder if we should increase the genesis delay to provide more time for those updates to be done and take some pressure off.

author: ajsutton
content: We definitely should stop scheduling things so the genesis becomes known on the weekend (or my day off, but that may be getting a little too picky)

author: paulhauner
content: I agree regarding extending the genesis delay. I feel that making the genesis state a surprise to the implementations is a risk without much reward.

author: djrtwo
content: yeah, I've been planning a proposed 96hr delay for mainnet config release

author: djrtwo
content: lol @ the weekend. It's always close! monday too close to weekend for launch so tuesday genesis, but then weekend to learn genesis... tough

author: djrtwo
content: maybe a thursday/friday for learning genesis and tuesday for genesis

author: ajsutton
content: I'd actually say having genesis towards the end of the week is better than early.  We *know* there's work to be done when genesis is known.  Hopefully there's nothing to be done after the chain kicks off because it all goes smoothly.

author: ajsutton
content: And that matches the experience we've had with testnets reasonably well.

author: ajsutton
content: Although it's pretty much a given there will be out of hours work for the actual mainnet launch - that's a one-off that's just how it goes.  Hopefully we won't need another testnet...
